org.apache.juneau.urlencoding

Class UrlEncodingSerializerSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Session
      • org.apache.juneau.BeanSession
        • org.apache.juneau.serializer.SerializerSession
          • org.apache.juneau.uon.UonSerializerSession
            • org.apache.juneau.urlencoding.UrlEncodingSerializerSession

  • public class UrlEncodingSerializerSession
extends UonSerializerSession
    Session object that lives for the duration of a single use of UrlEncodingSerializer.

    This class is NOT thread safe. It is meant to be discarded after one-time use.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UrlEncodingSerializerSession

        public UrlEncodingSerializerSession(UrlEncodingSerializerContext ctx,
                                    Boolean encode,
                                    ObjectMap op,
                                    Object output,
                                    Method javaMethod,
                                    Locale locale,
                                    TimeZone timeZone,
                                    MediaType mediaType,
                                    UriContext uriContext)
        Create a new session using properties specified in the context.
        Parameters:
        ctx - The context creating this session object. The context contains all the configuration settings for this object.
        encode - Overrides the UonSerializerContext.UON_encodeChars setting.
        output - The output object. See JsonSerializerSession.getWriter() for valid class types.
        op - The override properties. These override any context properties defined in the context.
        javaMethod - The java method that called this serializer, usually the method in a REST servlet.
        locale - The session locale. If null, then the locale defined on the context is used.
        timeZone - The session timezone. If null, then the timezone defined on the context is used.
        mediaType - The session media type (e.g. "application/json").
        uriContext - The URI context. Identifies the current request URI used for resolution of URIs to absolute or root-relative form.

    • Method Detail
